alert.note: Alert for Hernando; Pasco; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 3:44AM EDT until October 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Florida, including the following counties, in central Florida, Sumter. In west central Florida, Hernando and Pasco. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wildwood, Dade City, Bushnell, Hill n Dale, Lake Panasoffkee, Ridge Manor, Center Hill, Webster, Coleman, Croom, Lacoochee, Spring Lake, Tarrytown, Blanton, Wahoo, Dade City North, Darby, Sumterville, Masaryktown and Adamsville. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
